availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Franklin "Frank" Gregory (Graves County, Kentucky, student, clerk and first lieutenant (U.S.A.))

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, student, clerk, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Gabriel Gregory and Jane McGothy Gregory. Student in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. With his brother, Thomas "Jones" Gregory, he engaged in counter-guerilla activities in western Kentucky in 1861. Clerk in Paducah in 1863. Mustered into the 13th Tennessee Volunteer Cavalry Regiment, Bedford’s Battalion (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant in Paducah on October 26, 1863. Arrested and wounded by Major Bradford at Fort Pillow in Henning, Tennessee, on February 23, 1864. Died five days later of his wounds.

ab.bibl:
